attributes.action: Remove questions on 'ethnicity' from official questionnaires
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The notions of 'race', 'ethnicity' and similar categorisations have no scientific or moral basis. One can not be said to belong to a specific 'race' except as a purely social construction which only serves to create divisions and satisfy the primitive desire to inflexibly place everything into clearly-defined groups. There are no clearly-defined 'racial' groups, and saying that someone is a member of a specific race (or worse, and 'ethnic minority') simply means that they have a certain skin colour, hair colour, facial structure etc. - In other words, people are divided simply on the grounds of appearance. There is no genetic evidence to suggest people have different races; all humans are the same species and are genetically similar.

The government should not endorse the views of the small-minded by reinforcing the illusions of ethnicity and racial division. Nor should they consider someone's personal perception of their racial identity to be a particularly important characteristic. They do both of these by including questions on race and ethnicity in official questionnaires, and hence such questions should be omitted.
